description: After days of escalating protests and Council deadlock, Sven Halek privately resolves to anonymously leak Marek Halden’s personal logs, believing only public reckoning can restore legitimacy.

Citywide anonymous broadcasts release Halden’s logs, each posing ethical puzzles and candid accounts of BCI’s creation. Public debate erupts, with neighborhoods rallying to interpret the entries and debate Stenograd’s future.

In a bid to regain control, the Council announces a citywide challenge—decipher Halden’s remaining 'final instruction.' New grassroots leaders emerge, organizing open assemblies to collectively decode the message.

Multiple districts simultaneously solve Halden’s puzzle. His final message—advocating the restoration of collective civic voice and open self-government—galvanizes calls to dissolve the BCI. Council authority visibly fractures.
With public pressure mounting and alliances shifting, the Council formally cedes decision-making to neighborhood assemblies, marking the return of civic voice and ending the era of algorithmic rule.
